page.title: 09CHURCH STRETTON AGRICULTURE
page.content: In the Church Stretton area there are different types of agriculture. Most of the farm land on lower ground is permanent pasture, hay meadow, barley and occasionally oil seed rape. The farming on high ground is mostly sheep farming and cattle because crops do not grow as well on high ground. A little way out of Church Stretton is Acton Scott Farm Museum where they do farming the old way with the horse drawn plough. About 7 miles away from Church Stretton is Craven Arms where there is a farm machinery factory and a sheep market.
